DOES GOD GIVE AN "OK" TO KILL NEEDLESSLY KILL ANIMALS?
 
 First a little intro: My neighbor is a born again christian who literally slaughters squirrels, raccoons and armadillos emoticon_xkill . He kills them because they eat the bird seed he puts out as well as the pecans on his pecan tree. Yesterday, he was "smashing the s### of some squirrels he had cornered. (They also clean off every pecan on my tree TOO!.. but I refuse to kill them when all they are trying to do is survive! emoticon_xlove )
 
 I suggested to him that just maybe "his" God would not approve of his actions. He told me that God says it is ok to kill "THESE" animals.
 
 Now the QUESTION: Did god, according to the bible, give any thought of protecting his creatures from the likes of my neighbor? Is there a verse or two in the bible that addresses this type of action? emoticon_xangel 
 
 I am an atheist :( , but I suggested that he is not doing "god's" work and just maybe the devil has got hold of him? :xbanghead ...He really enjoys the killing. It makes his day. Whenever his kill one, the tells me that he got one of the b_ _ _ _ _ _ s!emoticon_mad 
 
 I would like to confront with a verse from the bible that addresses the needless killing of animals and see his reaction. emoticon_cool

post_info.post_title: Does God Give the "ok" To Kill....

charlie horse

Gen 1:26 And God went on to say: "Let us make man in our image, according to our likeness, and let them have in subjection the fish of the sea and the flying creatures of the heavens and the domestic animals and all the earth and every moving animal that is moving upon the earth." 27 And God proceeded to create the man in his image, in God's image he created him; male and female he created them. 28 Further, God blessed them and God said to them: "Be fruitful and become many and fill the earth and subdue it, and have in subjection the fish of the sea and the flying creatures of the heavens and every living creature that is moving upon the earth." 

 I suppose the question is: what is needless killing? He kills the squirrels that get the nuts, but you'd kill the flies that walk on your food, and the rodents and ants that invade your house, and the moles trashing your lawn.
 
 But for a Christian, having animals in subjection means acting as caretaker, not wantonly killing and enjoying it. That isn't exactly management.
samiinh

 ______________________________________________________________
 
 True, but there is a huge difference ... Flies and rodents bring disease. Ants invade the food you purchase making the leftovers unfit to eat. 
 
 As for moles... NOPE, I don't kill them... In fact I have one or two in my yard right now. How about spiders? Nope, not even if they are in my house... I catch and put them outside. 
 
 I value all animal life. emoticon_xangel . BUT, I would have no problem if he ate what he killed and I think the manner of killing should be taken into account.

 I was not rushed, just sarcastic, which does some across very well when written. My apologies. I will now explain, although I warn you, it will lose the biting pithiness of my first post. You will have to trust me, it may have sounded lame, but somewhere in there was some wit. (not)

 True, but there is a huge difference ... Flies and rodents bring disease. Ants invade the food you purchase making the leftovers unfit to eat.

 Ummm.
 
 Squirrles ARE rodents...aka tree rats.
 
 Pests are pests. Do with them as you wish.
 
 What your neighbor is doing is called culling.
 See, when a population of some species get out of control, they pose problems. For themselves and others. Thus, they need culling. Now, the ones he's killing are the weak useless ones that are no good for their gene pools...otherwise, they'd pass the 'must survive to breed' test. They got caught, so it's manifestly obvious that their continued behavior would be passed to their species and eventually lead to extermination.
 
 The next generations will know that eatting these nuts will lead to their demise through ingrained instinct.
 
 As for the bible...you can find justification for anything in it.
 That's why it's soo awsome! No one's going to toss out a guide to morality and spirituality that gives you carte blanc to do as you wish!
 
 Heck, I'm gonna use it as the basis of my 2012 presidential campaign.
 I plan on calling for the smashing in of the heads of liberals and the castration of conservatives.
 
 It's what God would want. 
 
 Oh, and since you're not a vegetarian...eat the kill.
 It's yummy delicious!
 
 Especially if you can taste the misery in the meat.
 
 
 
 If you really knew what some animals did...behind closed doors...I doubt you'd value their lives.

 Always remember though, when preaching to the converted...
 No matter where the Light goes, the Darkness was there first.

cuzzin99

I have an uncle who told me a similar story about, coincidentally, his own next-door neighbor. When I expressed my horror and wish not to hear the details, his response was "grow up!" While I respect my uncle for calling his neighbor out on his hypocritical ways, I also get the sense that he accepts such cruelty to animals as a part of life. These types of beliefs do not change the world. 
 
 I am an atheist by the way, raised as a Catholic. One of the few things I received from that religion was a good laugh at C.C.D. when we rearranged the Catholic kids' desks on Monday nights. My spiritual connection to the world and others now takes place in the form of working with other people in the community to try to save the lives of animals in my hometown. Sitting in church on Sunday never gave me as much joy or feeling as watching bony flea-bags walking home with their new "parents" to be spoiled and fattened up.
 
 The point of all this is is, obviously, action is called for and your neighbor's reason for brutalizing animals, his nut-bearing plants, need to be mysteriously chain-sawed out of his yard one night.
